revision.comment: /* Bilateral relations */clean up, [[WP:AWB/T|typo(s) fixed]]: a embassy → an embassy; combined refs
revision.text:
{{more citations needed|date=November 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2012}} {{Politics of Dominica}} Like its [[Eastern Caribbean]] neighbours, the main priority of [[Dominica]]'s foreign relations is economic development. The country maintains missions in Washington, New York, London, and Brussels and is represented jointly with other [[Organisation of Eastern Caribbean States]] (OECS) members in Canada. Dominica is also a member of the [[Caribbean Development Bank]] (CDB), and the [[Commonwealth of Nations]]. It became a member of the [[United Nations]] and the [[International Monetary Fund]] (IMF) in 1978 and of the [[World Bank]] and [[Organization of American States]] (OAS) in 1979.
As a member of [[CARICOM]], in July 1994 Dominica strongly backed efforts by the United States to implement [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 940]], designed to facilitate the departure of [[Haiti]]'s de facto authorities from power. The country agreed to contribute personnel to the multinational force, which restored the democratically elected government of Haiti in October 1994.
In May 1997, Prime Minister [[Edison James|James]] joined 14 other Caribbean leaders, and President [[Bill Clinton|Clinton]], during the first-ever U.S.-regional summit in [[Bridgetown, Barbados]]. The summit strengthened the basis for regional cooperation on justice and counternarcotics issues, finance and development, and trade. Dominica previously maintained official relations with the [[Republic of China]] (commonly known as "Taiwan") instead of the [[People's Republic of China]], but on 23 March 2004, a joint communique was signed in Beijing, paving the way for diplomatic recognition of the People's Republic. Beijing responded to Dominica's severing relations with the Republic of China by giving them a $12 million aid package, which includes $6 million in [[budget support]] for the year 2004 and $1 million annually for six years.
Dominica is also a member of the [[International Criminal Court]] with a Bilateral Immunity Agreement of protection for the [[United States|US]]-military (as covered under [[Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court|Article 98]]).
==International disputes==
Dominica claims [[Venezuela]]n controlled [[Isla Aves]] (Known in Dominica as Bird Rock) located roughly 90 km. west of Dominica.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20070930153618/http://www.nationnews.com/300078531512375.php Island talk for Caricom, Venezuela]</ref>
==Bilateral relations==
{| class="wikitable" style="width:100%; margin:auto;" |- ! style="width:4%;"| Country ! style="width:1%;"| Formal relations began ! style="width:20%;"| Notes |- valign="top" |{{flag|Algeria}}||{{dts|2006}} | Both countries established diplomatic relations in June 2006.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.thedominican.net/articles/newsdesk18.htm | title=Dominica Establishes Diplomatic Relations with Algeria | date=23 June 2006 | publisher=TheDominican.net | accessdate=29 April 2019 }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Andorra}}||{{dts|}} | No diplomatic relations have yet been established with [[Andorra]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.exteriors.ad/en/bilateral-and-consular-affairs/bilateral-affairs |title=Andorra Foreign ministry}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Argentina}}||{{dts|1985}} | Argentina and Dominica established diplomatic relation on 13 June 1985.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tratados.mrecic.gov.ar/tratado_ficha.php?id=8707 }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Armenia}}||2019 | Armenia and Dominica established diplomatic relations on 8 April 2019.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.armradio.am/en/10242|title=Armenia, Commonwealth of Dominica establish diplomatic relations|first=Helix Consulting|last=LLC|date=|work=armradio.am|accessdate=9 April 2019}}</ref><ref>[https://www.caribbeanwidenews.com/2019/04/12/dominica-establishes-diplomatic-relations-with-armenia/]</ref><ref>[https://www.dominicavibes.dm/news-257584/]</ref> .<ref>[https://www.mfa.am/en/bilateral-relations/dm]</ref><ref>[https://www.mfa.am/en/press-releases/2019/04/05/us/9357]</ref><ref name="dominicanewsonline.com">[https://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/dominica-establishes-diplomatic-relations-with-armenia/]</ref><ref name="dominicanewsonline.com"/>
|- valign="top" |{{flag|Australia}}||{{dts|}} | Australia is represented in Dominica through its High Commission in Trinidad and Tobago.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dfat.gov.au/geo/dominica/Pages/dominica.aspx|title=Department of Foreign Affairs of Australia}}</ref>
|- valign="top" |{{flag|Austria}}||{{dts|}} | *Since 2016, Austria is represented in Dominica by its embassy in [[Havana]], [[Cuba]].<ref>[https://www.bmeia.gv.at/en/embassies-consulates/search-for-austrian-representations/?tx_bmeiadb_piresults%5Bquery%5D=89&cHash=85aa4987aff3361d05f39418d6331750]</ref><ref>[https://www.bmeia.gv.at/oeb-havanna/bilaterales/laender-des-amtsbereiches/dominica/]</ref> *Dominica idoes not have any representation in Austria.<ref>[https://www.bmeia.gv.at/fileadmin/user_upload/oracle/gesamtliste_en.pdf]</ref><ref>[https://www.bmeia.gv.at/fileadmin/user_upload/oracle/konsulliste_en.pdf]</ref>
|- valign="top" |{{flag|Azerbaijan}}||{{dts|2011}} | Azerbaijan and Dominica have established diplomatic relations in 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dominicavibes.dm/news-2668/ }}</ref> Prime Minister [[Roosevelt Skerrit]] made an official visit to Azerbaijan later this year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedominican.net/2011/08/skerrit-on-visit-to-azerbaijan.html }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Barbados}}||{{dts|1978}} | Both countries established diplomatic relations on 3 November 1978.<ref>[https://www.foreign.gov.bb/documents/foreign-policy/22-countries-with-diplomaic-relations-with-barbados/file]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Belarus}}||{{dts|2004}} | Both countries established diplomatic relations on 9 July 2004.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mfa.gov.by/en/press/news_mfa/dea8e636a61cc994.html |title=On Establishment of Diplomatic Relations between Belarus and Dominica - Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Belarus |publisher=Mfa.gov.by |date=2004-07-09 |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Belgium}}||{{dts|1980}} | Belgium and Dominica established diplomatic relations since 1980.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/human-interest/dominica-welcomes-new-belgian-ambassador/ }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Belize}}||{{dts|1981}} | *Both countries have established diplomatic relations on 21 September 1981.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.mfa.gov.bz/images/documents/DIPLOMATIC%20RELATIONS.pdf |title=Archived copy |access-date=30 December 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171230194831/http://www.mfa.gov.bz/images/documents/DIPLOMATIC%20RELATIONS.pdf |archive-date=30 December 2017 |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mfa.gov.bz/index.php/library/belize-bilateral-treaties/113-dominica |title=Dominica |publisher=Mfa.gov.bz |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> *Both countries are full members of both [[Commonwealth of Nations]] and [[Association of Caribbean States]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Bosnia and Herzegovina}}||{{dts|2014}} | Bosnia and Herzegovina and Dominica established diplomatic relation on 6 March 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mvp.gov.ba/vanjska_politika_bih/bilateralni_odnosi/datumi_priznanja_i_uspostave_diplomatskih_odnosa/?id=6 |title=Bosnia and Herzegovina ministry of foreign affairs }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Botswana}}||{{dts|2007}} | Both countries established diplomatic relations on 23 July 2007.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mofaic.gov.bw/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=135:bilateral-relations-c&catid=2&Itemid=53 |title=Bilateral Relations: C |publisher=Mofaic.gov.bw |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161224035109/http://www.mofaic.gov.bw/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=135:bilateral-relations-c&catid=2&Itemid=53 |archive-date=24 December 2016 |url-status=dead }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Brazil}}||{{dts|1986}} | Both countries established diplomatic relations in 1986.<ref>{{cite web|author=CARICOM Secretariat |url=http://caricom.org/communications/view/brazil-and-dominica-sign-pair-of-cooperation-agreements |title=Brazil and Dominica Sign Pair of Cooperation Agreements —Caribbean Community (CARICOM) Secretariat |publisher=Caricom |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Bulgaria}}||{{dts|}} | Bulgaria is represented in Dominica through its embassy in [[Cuba]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mfa.bg/index.php?page=15&staticpage=findanembassy&posolstvo=49 |title=Министерство на външните работи - Намери посолство |publisher=Mfa.bg |date=2016-10-21 |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Canada}}||{{dts|1978}} | *Both countries established diplomatic relations in 1978.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/general/canada-reinforces-38-years-of-relations-with-dominica/ |title=Canada reinforces 38 years of relations with Dominica – Dominica News Online |publisher=Dominicanewsonline.com |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> *Bilateral relations are described as "close and friendly."<ref name="canada">[http://www.canadainternational.gc.ca/barbados-barbade/bilateral_relations_bilaterales/canada_dominica-dominique.aspx?lang=eng Canada - Dominica relations]</ref> *Canada is represented in Dominica, through its High Commission in Barbados.<ref name="canada"/> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Colombia}}||{{dts|1980}}<ref name="cancilleria">{{cite web |url=http://www.cancilleria.gov.co/antigua-y-barbuda-barbados-dominica-grenada-san-cristobal-y-nieves-santa-lucia-san-vicente|title=Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Colombia (in Spanish only)}}</ref> | Both countries established diplomatic relations on 9 December 1980. Colombia is represented in Dominica through its embassy in [[Kingstown]], [[Jamaica]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cancilleria.gov.co/antigua-y-barbuda-barbados-dominica-grenada-san-cristobal-y-nieves-santa-lucia-san-vicente|title=Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Colombia (in Spanish only)}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Chile}}||{{dts|}} | Both countries have diplomatic relations. Both countries waived visa for diplomatic passports holders.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/international-relations/dominica-chile-signs-visa-waiver-agreement/ }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Costa Rica}}||{{dts|2001}} | Costa Rica and Dominica have established diplomatic relations in 2001.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedominican.net/articles/costarica.htm }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Croatia}}||{{dts|2013}}<ref name=mvep>{{cite web |url=http://www.mvep.hr/en/foreign-politics/bilateral-relations/overview-by-country/dominica,168.html|title=Ministry Foreign Affairs of Croatia}}</ref> | Joint Communiqué on the Establishment of Diplomatic Relations between the Republic of [[Croatia]] and the Commonwealth of Dominica was signed on 30 July 2013.<ref name=mvep/> |- valign="top" |{{flag|People's Republic of China}}||{{dts|2004}}<ref name="un">{{cite web|url=http://www.un.int/wcm/content/site/dominica/pid/3482|title=Dominica's Diplomatic Relations.doc|work=Permanent Mission of the Commonwealth of Dominica to the United Nations|accessdate=19 February 2011|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722013335/http://www.un.int/wcm/content/site/dominica/pid/3482|archivedate=22 July 2011|df=dmy-all}}</ref> | Diplomatic relations were established on 31 March 2004, when Dominica suspended ties with the [[Republic of China]] ([[Taiwan]]).<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/country_profiles/1166512.stm Timeline: Dominica] [[BBC News]]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Cuba}}||{{dts|1996}} | In December 2005, during the second CARICOM/CUBA summit held in Barbados, heads of CARICOM and Cuba agreed to deepen their ties in the areas of socio-economic and political cooperation in addition to medical care assistance. Since the meeting, Cuba has opened four additional embassies in the Caribbean Community including Dominica.<ref>[http://www.caribbeannetnews.com/cgi-script/csArticles/articles/000008/000823.htm Caribbean Net News: Cuba opens more Caribbean embassies] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090415220746/http://www.caribbeannetnews.com/cgi-script/csArticles/articles/000008/000823.htm |date=15 April 2009}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Cyprus}}||{{dts|2001}}<ref name=olc>{{cite web|url=http://www.olc.gov.cy/olc/olc.nsf/all/612F31F6B9155609C22575D7002390BE/$file/DOMINICA.pdf?openelement|title=Ministry Foreign Affairs of Cyprus|access-date=6 September 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119062538/http://www.olc.gov.cy/olc/olc.nsf/all/612F31F6B9155609C22575D7002390BE/$file/DOMINICA.pdf?openelement|archive-date=19 November 2016|url-status=dead}}</ref> | Both countries are members of the [[Commonwealth of Nations]]. A Joint Communiqué on the Establishment of Diplomatic Relations between the Republic of [[Cyprus]] and the Commonwealth of Dominica was signed on 13 June 2001 in [[New York City|New York]]<ref name=olc/> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Czech Republic}}||{{dts|1996}} | The Czech Republic and Dominica have formalized diplomatic relations since 1996.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedominican.net/2012/06/czech-ambassador-presents-credentials.html }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Denmark}}||{{dts|1985}} | Denmark is represented in Dominica, through its embassy in Mexico.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.um.dk/da/menu/OmOs/Organisation/AmbassaderMv/Nordamerika/Dominica.htm|title=Dominica|publisher=Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Denmark|accessdate=3 November 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101226113445/http://www.um.dk/da/menu/OmOs/Organisation/AmbassaderMv/Nordamerika/Dominica.htm|archive-date=26 December 2010|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Djibouti}}||{{dts|2018}} | Both countries established diplomatic relations on 9 January 2018.<ref>[https://www.un.int/djibouti/news/establishment-diplomatic-relations-between-republic-djibouti-and-commonwealth-dominica]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Ecuador}}||{{dts|2009}} | Dominica and Ecuador established diplomatic relation on 24 June 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cancilleria.gob.ec/ecuador-and-dominica-strengthen-education-and-agriculture-cooperation/ }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Fiji}}||{{dts|2014}} | Dominica and Fiji established diplomatic relations in 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fiji.gov.fj/Media-Center/Press-Releases/DOMINICA-AND-FIJI-FORMALISE-DIPLOMATIC-RELATIONS.aspx }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Finland}}||{{dts|2009}}<ref name=formin>{{cite web |url=http://formin.finland.fi/public/default.aspx?nodeid=17294&culture=en-US&contentlan=2|title=Ministry Foreign Affairs of Finland}}</ref> | [[Finland]] recognised Dominica on 23 February 1979. Diplomatic relations were established on 19 August 2009.<ref name=formin/> |- valign="top" |{{flag|France}}||{{dts|1979}}<ref name=france>{{cite web |url=http://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/general/president-liverpool-welcomes-new-french-ambassador/}}</ref> | France is represented in Dominica, through its embassy in [[Saint Lucia]]. Dominica and France have signed many bilateral agreements.<ref>[http://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/fr/pays-zones-geo_833/dominique_11404/dominique-france_11961/index.html Bilateral relations between Dominica France] {{in lang|fr}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Gambia}}||{{dts|2012}} | Both countries established diplomatic relations on 26 July 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/731923.shtml |title=Gambia, Dominica establish diplomatic ties: foreign ministry |work=Global Times |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Germany}}||{{dts|1980}} | Both countries have diplomatic relations since 1980.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/economy-development/ambassador-of-germany-presents-credentials-to-president-of-dominica/}}</ref> Political and economic relations are friendly but fairly low-key.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/EN/Aussenpolitik/Laender/Laenderinfos/01-Nodes/Dominica_node.html|title=Federal Foreign Office of Germany}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Georgia}}||{{dts|2010}} | Dominica and Georgia established diplomatic relation on 15 December 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mfa.gov.ge/MainNav/ForeignPolicy/BilateralRelations/%E1%83%93%E1%83%9D%E1%83%9B%E1%83%98%E1%83%9C%E1%83%98%E1%83%99%E1%83%98%E1%83%A1-%E1%83%97%E1%83%90%E1%83%9C%E1%83%90%E1%83%9B%E1%83%94%E1%83%92%E1%83%9D%E1%83%91%E1%83%A0%E1%83%9D%E1%83%91%E1%83%90.aspx }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Greece}}||{{dts|2005}}<ref name="mfa greece">{{cite web |url=http://www.mfa.gr/en/blog/greece-bilateral-relations/dominica/|title=Ministry Foreign Affairs of Greece}}</ref> | Diplomatic relations were established on 15 November 2005. [[Greece]] is represented in Dominica via parallel accreditation of its embassy in [[Caracas]]. Dominica has appointed an ambassador accredited to Greece, based in [[Roseau, Dominica]].<ref name="mfa greece"/> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Grenada}}||{{dts|}} | Both countries are full members of the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], of the [[Organization of American States]] and of the [[Caribbean Community]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Guyana}}||{{dts|1978}} | Dominica and Guyana have established diplomatic relations on 3 November 1978.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.minfor.gov.gy/docs/other/diplomatic_relations_list.pdf |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160307101008/http://www.minfor.gov.gy/docs/other/diplomatic_relations_list.pdf |archivedate=7 March 2016 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Guyana has a [[High Commission]] in [[Roseau]].<ref>[http://www.guyana.org/govt/foreign_missions.html Guyana's Diplomatic & Consular Representatives]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Holy See}}||{{dts|1982}} | Dominica and the Holy See have had diplomatic relations since 1982.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/international-relations/dominicas-ambassador-to-holy-see-presents-credentials/}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vatican.va/news_services/press/documentazione/documents/corpo-diplomatico/corpo-diplomatico_stati_elenco_en.html |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140906041527/https://www.vatican.va/news_services/press/documentazione/documents/corpo-diplomatico/corpo-diplomatico_stati_elenco_en.html |archivedate=6 September 2014 |df=dmy}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Honduras}}||{{dts|2014}} | Both countries established diplomatic relations on 4 June 2014<ref>[http://www.oas.org/en/media_center/press_release.asp?sCodigo=E-235/14]</ref> during the [[General Assembly of the Organization of American States]] in [[Asunción]].
|- valign="top" |{{flag|Hungary}}||{{dts|}} | Hungary is represented in Dominica by its embassy in [[Havana]], [[Cuba]].<ref>[https://havanna.mfa.gov.hu/]</ref><ref>[https://www.kormany.hu/en/ministry-of-foreign-affairs-and-trade/missions]</ref>
|- valign="top" |{{flag|Iceland}}||{{dts|}} | *Both countries established diplomatic relations in 2004.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iceland.is/iceland-abroad/un/nyc/embassy |title=Embassy |publisher=Iceland.is |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612184723/https://www.iceland.is/iceland-abroad/un/nyc/embassy |archive-date=12 June 2018 |url-status=dead }}</ref> *Iceland is represented in Dominica through its embassy in [[New York City|New York]], United States. Both countries have an agreement on cooperation on geothermal energy.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mfa.is/news-and-publications/nr/4938 |title=Iceland Foreign ministry}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Ireland}}||{{dts|}} | Ireland is represented in Dominica through its embassy in [[Washington, D.C.]], [[United States]].<ref>[https://www.dfa.ie/travel/travel-advice/a-z-list-of-countries/dominica/]</ref><ref>[https://www.dfa.ie/embassies/irish-embassies-abroad/north-and-central-america/dominica/]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|India}}||{{dts|1981}} |See [[Dominica–India relations]] Dominica and India established diplomatic relation in 1981.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mea.gov.in/Portal/ForeignRelation/Commonwealth_of_Dominica_Dec_2014.pdf }}</ref> Both countries are members of the [[Commonwealth of Nations]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Indonesia}}||{{dts|}} | Indonesia is represented in Dominica through its embassy in [[Caracas]], [[Venezuela]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kemlu.go.id/caracas/id/default.aspx|title=Kedutaan Besar Republik Indonesia}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Israel}}||{{dts|1979}} | *Both countries established diplomatic relations in 1979.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.gov.dm/index.php/news/3476-daniel-saban-is-new-israeli-ambassador-to-dominica |title=Daniel Saban is New Israeli Ambassador to Dominica |publisher=News.gov.dm |date=2016-03-18 |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> *Israel is represented in Dominica through its embassy in [[Santo Domingo]], [[Dominican Republic]]. *Both countries have an agreement on visa abolition.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mfa.gov.il/Style%20Library/AmanotPdf/006527.pdf |title=Israel Foreign ministry}}</ref>
|- valign="top" |{{flag|Italy}}||{{dts|}} | Italy is represented in Dominica by its embassy in [[Caracas]], [[Venezuela]].<ref>[https://ambcaracas.esteri.it/ambasciata_caracas/en/ambasciata/sedi_accreditate]</ref>
|- valign="top" |{{flag|Japan}}||{{dts|1978}}<ref name=mofa>{{cite web |url=http://www.mofa.go.jp/region/latin/c_dominica/data.html|title=Ministry Foreign Affairs of Japan}}</ref> | Diplomatic relations were established in December 1978.<ref name=mofa/> Japan is represented in Dominica through its embassy in Trinidad and Tobago .<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tt.emb-japan.go.jp/about%20us.htm |title=Embassy of Japan in Trinidad and Tobago |publisher=Tt.emb-japan.go.jp |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Kazakhstan}}||{{dts|2016}} | Both countries established diplomatic relations on 15 May 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.inform.kz/en/diplomatic-relations-established-between-kazakhstan-and-commonwealth-of-dominica_a2558204 }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|North Korea}}||{{dts|1978}} | Since November 1978, the bilateral relations have been cordial and fruitful.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://search.naver.com/search.naver?where=nexearch&query=%EB%B6%81%ED%95%9C+%EB%8F%84%EB%AF%B8%EB%8B%88%EC%B9%B4+%EC%88%98%EA%B5%90&sm=top_hty&fbm=0&ie=utf8 |title=북한 도미니카 수교 : 네이버 통합검색 |publisher=Search.naver.com |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Kosovo}}||{{dts|2012}} | Dominica and Kosovo established diplomatic relation on 11 December 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mfa-ks.net/?page=2,217,1536 |title=Kosovo Foreign ministry}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Kyrgyzstan}}||{{dts|2016}} | Both countries established diplomatic relations on 18 October 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kabar.kg/eng/politics/full/17236 |title=Kyrgyzstan and the Commonwealth of Dominica establish diplomatic relations :: Kabar - Kyrgyz National News Agency |publisher=Kabar.kg |date=2017-03-01 |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Latvia}}||{{dts|2007}}<ref name="mfa latvia">{{cite web |url=http://www.mfa.gov.lv/en/news/latest-news/8841-latvia-establishes-diplomatic-relations-with-dominica|title=Ministry Foreign Affairs of Latvia}}</ref> | Diplomatic relations were established on 27 September 2007 in [[New York City|New York]].<ref name="mfa latvia"/> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Libya}}||{{dts|}} | Dominica and Libya maintain diplomatic relations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/politics/dominica-libya-relationship-still-intact-henderson/ }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Lithuania}}||{{dts|2013}}<ref name=urm>{{cite web |url=https://www.urm.lt/default/en/bilateral-dominica|title=Ministry Foreign Affairs of Lithuania}}</ref> | Diplomatic relations were established on 7 October 2013.<ref name=urm/>

|- valign="top" |{{flag|United Kingdom}}||{{dts|1979}} | On 3 November 1978, Dominica received independence from the United Kingdom as a [[Commonwealth republic]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|United States}}||{{dts|1979}} |See [[Dominica–United States relations]] The United States and Dominica have friendly relations. United States supports the Dominican government's efforts to expand its economic base and to provide a higher [[standard of living]] for its citizens. U.S. assistance is primarily channeled through multilateral agencies such as the [[World Bank]] and the [[Caribbean Development Bank]], as well as through the [[U.S. Agency for International Development]] office in [[Bridgetown, Barbados]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Uruguay}}||{{dts|2011}} | Dominica and Uruguay established diplomatic relation on 1 March 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mrree.gub.uy/frontend/page?1,main,ampliacion-ppal,O,en,0,PAG;CONC;73;3;D;establishment-of-diplomatic-relations-between-uruguay-and-the-commonwealth-of-dominica;2;PAG; }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Venezuela}}||{{dts|1979}} | President of Venezuela [[Hugo Chávez]] visited Dominica in 2007.<ref>[http://www.thedominican.net/articles/chavezvisit.htm President Hugo Chávez of Venezuela Pays Historic Visit to Dominica]</ref> Dominica has once claimed the Venezuelan island [[Isla Aves]], but the claim was stopped as Prime Minister [[Roosevelt Skerrit]] has declared that Isla Aves belongs to Venezuela. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Vietnam}}||{{dts|2013}} | Dominica and Vietnam established diplomatic relation on 1 November 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mofa.gov.vn/en/nr040807104143/nr040807105001/ns131104152306/view }}</ref> |}
== Dominica and the Commonwealth of Nations ==
The Commonwealth of Dominica has been a member of the [[Commonwealth of Nations]] since 1978, when it became an independent [[Commonwealth republic]] from the United Kingdom.
Dominica's highest court of appeal is the [[Caribbean Court of Justice]], in effect from 6 March 2015. Previously, the nation's ultimate court of appeal was the [[Judicial Committee of the Privy Council]] in London.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.jamaicaobserver.com/news/Dominica-fully-joins-Caribbean-Court-of-Justice | title=Dominica fully joins Caribbean Court of Justice | newspaper=Jamaica Observer | date=6 March 2015 | accessdate=12 March 2016 }}</ref>
== Dominica and La Francophonie ==
The Commonwealth of Dominica has been a member of [[Organisation internationale de la Francophonie]] since 1979.
As a French and then [[British Empire|British colony]]; [[Antillean Creole]], a [[French-based creole languages|French-based creole]] language, is spoken by 90% of the population. The Commonwealth of Dominica is nestled between two [[island|insular]] overseas outer [[regions of France]], [[Guadeloupe]] (situated to the north), and [[Martinique]] (situated to the south). A number of links exist between Dominica and its French neighbours to north and south.
